sections.title: Opening: The World Divided
sections.objective: Introduce the post‑World War II landscape and the emergence of two opposing superpowers, setting the stage for the Cold War.

sections.title: Rising Tensions: Ideology and Arms
sections.objective: Explain how competing ideologies, the Truman Doctrine, and the arms race escalated mistrust between the United States and the Soviet Union.

sections.title: Proxy Conflicts: Battles Without Direct Fire
sections.objective: Showcase key proxy wars—Korea, Vietnam, and the Cuban Missile Crisis—as flashpoints that amplified global stakes without direct superpower combat.

sections.title: The Nuclear Brink: Deterrence and Fear
sections.objective: Explore the doctrine of Mutually Assured Destruction, the space race, and moments when the world teetered on the edge of nuclear war.

sections.title: Resolution & Legacy: From Collapse to Echoes
sections.objective: Detail the dissolution of the Soviet Union, the end of the Cold War, and the lasting political, cultural, and technological impacts today.
